Name of Work: - Independent Engineering Services for the work of Six Lanning of 
Varanasi Aurangabad section of NH-2 from Km. 786.00 to Km. 978.400 in the state of 
U.P./Bihar on Design, Build, Finance, Operate and Transfer (DBFOT) Toll Basis under 
NHDP Phase-V Subject: -Un-necessary closure of lanes at Mohania Toll Plaza at ( Km 
860.00) reg. 
Ref:NHAI Letter: NHAI/PIU-SSM/SOMA/2024/8723 dated 22.01.2024 
Dear Sir 
In continuation of the above subject and letter, it is observed that the concessionaire is 
not adhering to the Concession Agreement Clause 17 .14 The Authority shall procure that 
during the Operation Period, no barriers are erected or placed by any Government 
Instrumentality on the Project Highway except for reasons of Emergency, national 
security, law and order or collection of inter-state taxes.

The authority shall also make 
best endeavours to procure that no Government Instrumentality shall undertake or cause 
to be undertaken, xcept for reasons of Emergency , national security or law and order, 
any diversions of traffic from, or closing down of approach roads to the Project Highway 
that may cause a material adverse effect on the flow of traffic to and from the Project 
Highway . 
As per clause 19.6 of the Concession Agreement, the Concessionaire shall, before the 
expiry of each day, send to the Authority and the Independent Engineer, by facsimile or 
e-mail, a report stating accidents and unusual incidents relating to safety and security on 
the Project Highw ay. safety of users and Project Highway but in the event, you have 
breached clause 19.6(e) 
Therefore, you are in breach of your contractual obligations, you are requested to explain 
as to why 4lanes w ere closed out of 5 lanes on LHS side as reported by PD PIU at site. 
This has affected the smooth flow of traffic and led to heavy traffic Jam at Mohnia Toll 
plaza.

available immediately.

Sub: Six laning of Varanasi-Aurangabad Sanction of NH-2 from Km 786.00 to Km978.400 
In the state of UP and Bihar on DBFOT (Toll) Basis under NHDP Phase-V- Providing
the chainage wise details of unauthorized median cuts & closure of the same with
immediate effect - reg.
Ref: i). This office letter no. 8900 dated 11.03.2024 
ii). This office letter no.

Ref: i). This office letter no. 8900 dated 11.03.2024 
ii). This office letter no. 8901 dated 11.03.2024 
iii). OM, Kaimoor letter no. 701 dated 15.03.2024 
Sir, 
Please refer this office letter u/r (i), vide which it was requested to provide the 
chainage wise, Circle wise & District wise details of unauthorized median cuts & take 
urgent action for closures of the same with the help of local administration & Police, if 
required. But neither desired informations have been provided, nor any action has been 
taken towards closures of unauthorized median cuts developed on the project highway, 
so far. 
This office vide letter u/r (i) has also intimated about massive road accident 
happened on 25.02.2024 near an unauthorized median cut formed at Km 864.750 
(Dewkali) in District Kaimoor in which 09 nos of persons were killed. Subsequently, this 
office vide letter u/r (ii) has requested OM Kaimoor for providing administrative & Police 
support for closure of said unauthorized median cut. The copy of this letter was also 
endorsed to Concessionaire & IE for follow up for closure of said unauthorized median 
cut. But none of the representatives of Concessionaire & IE has contacted local 
administr ation & Police for closing the same. DM, Kaimoor vide letter u/r (iii) has 
expressed displeasure over casual approach adopted in closure of unauthorized median 
cut. 
In view of above, it is directed to take necessary action on priority.

Project: Six laning of Varanasi -Aurangabad Section of NH-2 from Km 786.000 
to Km 978.400 in the State of UP/Bihar on Design, Build, Finance, Operate and 
Transfer (The 'DBFOT') Toll Basis under NHDP Phase-V 
Subject: Implementation and Integration of Advanced Traffic Management 
System (ATMS) as per NHAI Policy Circular no 11.53/2023 dated 10th Oct 2023-
Request for issuance of Change of Scope Notice as per Clause 16.2.1 of 
Concession Agreement (CA). 
Reference: 1.

Reference: 1. SI-PO/NH-2/2023-24/14810 dated 7th March 2024. 
Dear Sir, 
2. LNM/PD/NHAI/V-A/2023-24/9967 dated 19th February 2024. 
3. Contract Agreement dated July 2010. 
4. NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Standard Documents/policy Circular 
No.11.53/2023 dated 10th October 2023. 
5. ICAI/Members/Training/2023-24/1165 dated 04.03.2024. 
With reference (1) cited above, letter from Concessionaire regarding compliance 
of IE's letter no 9967 cited under reference (2), following are the comments & 
observations from IE: 
1. Concessionaire mentioned in letter no 14810 dated 7th March 2024 that a 
joint site visit with IE has been done on 2nd November 2023, but that visit 
was not with an ATMS Expert. Hence for final count of ATMS Equipment's a 
joint site visit with Concessionaire, ATMS Expert & Safety Expert is required. 
2. Point 4.18 Advance Traffic Management Systems in Contract Agreement the 
clause 4.18.3 (b) "Video cameras installed on road with such pan and tilts 
that a length of 2 km road is captured for video monitoring of traffic"" 
These cameras are of 4MP size & cost is between 2.5 lakhs to 6 lakhs. 
3. As Concessionaire believe ECB, MRCS are obsolete equipment's hence 
negative COS has to be considered for Equipment's like ATCC, ECB & MRCS. 
• Bhopal • Indore • Mumbai ■ f,)une

4. Also, in reference (5) cited above IHMCL conducted a training for all 
Authority Engineers and System Integrators on 4th March 2024 at NHAI 
Head Quarters Delhi, where Authority Engineers were guided for providing 
COS for Policy Circular 11.53 cited as reference (2) above. Specially COS 
would be provided for VIDES & VSDS only. 
Hence Concessionaire is requested to revise the list of ATMS Equipment's and 
its price as per the comments mentioned above and submit a new ATMS Plan. 
Thanking you and assurance our best services. 
For, L.N. Malviya Infra Projects Pvt. Ltd. 
Dr.L. 
(Chairman hnn'111'fflrging Dir (HTMSffoll Expert)

4 Provisions of Article 17 of concession agreement is applicable from the date of 
commencement of commercial operation. Your contention that Pavement failures 
like Rutting, undulations and cracks in the surface is due to overloaded vehicles 
using the project highway is not agreed to as the same is your responsibility as per 
Article 17 .1.1 of CA. Your attention is drawn to subcases 17 .1.1 (g) for the same. 
In case you have taken adequate preventing measures with the assistance of 
concerned law enforcement agencies with information to Authority, please, 
elucidate the same for the assistance by the Authority In this connection your 
kind attention is invited to Article 27.10 of Concession agreement -Additional fee 
for Overloaded vehicles are applicable. It has been noticed that the same are being 
applied in the Project Highway while collecting user fee by you. Therefore, your 
contention that the overloading of vehicles is responsibility of Authority and State 
Govt is not agreed to.

Therefore, your 
contention that the overloading of vehicles is responsibility of Authority and State 
Govt is not agreed to. 
5 Also, your attention is drawn to Article 17 .11.1 ( d) & ( e) reproduced as under: 
"During the Operation Period, the Concessionaire shall operate and maintain 
the Project Highway in accordance with this Agreement either by itself, or 
through the O&M Contractor and if required, modify, repair or otherwise make 
improvements to the Project Highway to comply with the provisions of this 
Agreement, Applicable Laws and Applicable Permits, and conform to 
Specifications and Standards and 
Good Industry Practice. The Obligations of the Concessionaire hereunder shall 
include: 
(d)Carrying out periodic preventive maintenance of the Project Highway; 
(e) Undertaking routine maintenance including prompt repairs of potholes, 
cracks, joints, drains, embankments, structures, pavement markings, lighting, 
road signs and other traffic control devices. 
In view of above, the concessionaire is requested to comply with contractual 
obligations, otherwise shall be penalized as per provision of Article 17.8 of 
concession agreement.

Sub : Six laning of Varanasi-Aurangabad Sanction of NH-2 from Km 786.00 to Km978.400 
In the state of UP and Bihar on DBFOT (Toll) Basis under NHDP Phase-V- Un­
necessary closure of lanes at Mohania Toll plaza at (Km.860.00)-reg. 
Sir, 
In the above subject, it is intimated that during surprise check on 22.01.2024 at 
08:30 AM, it was noticed that toll collection was being carried out only through a single 
lane on LHS and there were huge traffic Jam happened at toll plaza at that time. The site 
photographs are enclosed herewith for ready reference. 
There was a toll personnel present at toll plaza and he was asked about above 
incident why 04 nos. toll lanes out of total 05 nos. toll lanes are closed on LHS . Firstly, he 
misbehaved in talking and told that it is not possible for toll both operators to attend the 
duty in so early morning hours in ongoing foggy season. Further he said that you are free 
to complain anywhere in this regard. 
The behavior of toll persor;inel was completely surprised and it attracts the penal 
action against Concessionaire ~ 1"'accordance to NHAI Policy circular no. 17.5.86/2023 
dated 05.10.2023 and previous relevant circulars. It also attracts penal action against 
Concessionaire on account of lane closure under provisions of article 17.7 of Concession 
Agreement. 
In view of above, please explain why not action be taken against the concession 
for the above mentioned event. ~..,_•
